intro: Ackama brassii, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a striking visual element to its appearance. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many other spurge species. Ackama brassii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms.
